intro: Corchorus brachycarpus, commonly known as narrowcarp cuphalmus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in wet or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
